pullRequest.title: Modularize and Refactor the Debezium Tutorial
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR modularizes the tutorial so that the applicable content can be reused downstream for the OpenShift version.
A couple notes:

I mostly followed the same modularization scheme/approach as the MySQL connector doc, so it should be familiar.
The content should not have any technical changes, but I did restructure, move, revise, and condense it in places.
In antora.yml, I added a couple new attributes to handle linking. This is to handle scenarios where, in the upstream, a link is an asciidoc "xref", but in the downstream is an asciidoc "link" (with a different syntax).
I manually built the website and verified that the tutorial built correctly.

nodes.bodyText:
This note does not seem to be aligned with what we convey at https://debezium.io/releases/, as we indicate that the 1.1 version was tested with both Connect 1.x and 2.x.  I also don't think anything we make reference to here is specific to Connect 2.4 versions previous versions either.
@gunnarmorling @jpechane , I think we should reword/omit this but wanted your opinions.  I'm pondering if we could point the user to the releases tested with matrix?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+// Metadata created by nebel
+//
+// ParentAssemblies: assemblies/tutorial/as_starting-services.adoc
+// UserStory:
+
+[id="starting-kafka"]
+= Starting Kafka
+
+After starting ZooKeeper, you can start Kafka in a new container.
+
+[NOTE]

commit.message: Add reference to test matrix compatibility for upstream only
